name: Flat Barbell Bench Press
description: The flat bench press is a compound movement that targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps. It's performed by lying on a bench and pressing a barbell upward from chest level.

name: Incline Dumbbell Press
description: An incline dumbbell press emphasizes the upper chest. It's performed by lying on an incline bench and pressing dumbbells upward from shoulder level.

name: Decline Bench Press
description: The decline bench press focuses on the lower part of the chest. It is performed by lying on a decline bench and pressing a barbell upward.

name: Chest Fly
description: Chest fly is performed by lying on a flat bench and using dumbbells to make a wide arc motion. It stretches and contracts the chest muscles.

name: Push-Ups
description: Push-ups are a bodyweight exercise that targets the chest, triceps, and shoulders. Start in a plank position and lower yourself to the ground, then push up.

name: Cable Crossover
description: Cable crossovers isolate the chest by pulling cables from a high position downwards in a crossover motion, focusing on the inner chest muscles.

name: Dips (Chest Version)
description: Chest dips involve leaning forward while performing dips on parallel bars, engaging the lower chest muscles.

name: Incline Bench Press
description: Incline bench presses target the upper chest. The bench is set at a 30-45 degree angle, and the barbell or dumbbells are pressed from chest level.

name: Machine Chest Press
description: Machine chest presses allow for controlled pressing of weights to target the chest muscles without the need for balancing free weights.

name: Pec Deck Machine
description: The pec deck machine isolates the chest muscles by moving the arms together in a butterfly-like motion while seated.

name: Dumbbell Pullover
description: The dumbbell pullover is performed by lying on a bench and moving a dumbbell from overhead to above the chest, targeting the chest and lats.

name: Close-Grip Bench Press
description: The close-grip bench press targets the inner chest and triceps. It's performed by pressing a barbell from chest level with a narrow grip.

name: Landmine Chest Press
description: The landmine chest press is performed by pressing a barbell anchored in a landmine attachment at a 45-degree angle. It targets the chest and shoulders.

name: Svend Press
description: The Svend press involves pressing a weight plate forward while squeezing the chest muscles. It's a great exercise for activating the inner chest.

name: Floor Press
description: The floor press is a partial range bench press done while lying on the floor. It limits the range of motion and emphasizes the chest and triceps.

name: Resistance Band Chest Press
description: A chest press using resistance bands simulates the movement of a traditional press while maintaining tension throughout the range of motion.

name: Standing Cable Chest Press
description: The standing cable chest press is done using cables in a standing position, allowing for greater activation of stabilizing muscles.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
description: A Smith machine bench press offers guided movement, allowing you to safely target the chest muscles without worrying about balance.

name: Plate Pinch Press
description: The plate pinch press involves holding a weight plate between your palms and pressing it forward while squeezing your chest.

name: Suspension Trainer Chest Press
description: Using a suspension trainer (like TRX), you perform a chest press by leaning into the straps and pressing your body weight away from the handles.

name: Deadlift
description: A compound movement that works the entire posterior chain, including the back, glutes, and hamstrings. It involves lifting a barbell from the ground to hip level.

name: Pull-Up
description: A bodyweight exercise that targets the upper back, lats, and biceps. Performed by pulling yourself up until your chin passes the bar.

name: Bent-Over Barbell Row
description: A classic back exercise that targets the lats, rhomboids, and lower back. Performed by pulling a barbell towards your torso while bent over at the hips.

name: Lat Pulldown
description: This exercise focuses on the latissimus dorsi muscles by pulling a bar down towards the chest while seated.

name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Row
description: Performed by pulling a dumbbell towards your torso with one arm at a time while bent over a bench. It targets the lats and middle back.

name: Seated Cable Row
description: Using a cable machine, this movement targets the middle back. Pull the handles towards your torso while sitting with legs extended.

name: T-Bar Row
description: A variation of the row using a T-bar machine, focusing on the middle back and lats. Performed by pulling a handle towards your torso while bent at the hips.

name: Reverse Fly
description: Targets the rear deltoids and upper back muscles. Its performed by moving dumbbells outward in a wide arc while bending at the hips.

name: Good Morning
description: Primarily a lower back exercise, the good morning involves bending at the hips while keeping a barbell on your shoulders, then returning to an upright position.

name: Romanian Deadlift
description: This variation of the deadlift targets the hamstrings and lower back by keeping the legs more extended while lifting and lowering a barbell.

name: Inverted Row
description: A bodyweight exercise performed by hanging from a bar and pulling your chest towards it. It targets the upper and middle back.

name: Face Pull
description: A cable exercise that targets the rear delts and upper back. Pull the cable towards your face while keeping your elbows high.

name: Shrug
description: Primarily a trap exercise, shrugs involve lifting the shoulders while holding dumbbells or a barbell, focusing on the upper back.

name: Yates Row
description: A variation of the barbell row with a more upright posture, emphasizing the traps and rhomboids.

name: Chest-Supported Row
description: This row variation uses a chest-supported bench to prevent lower back strain while rowing dumbbells or a barbell.

name: Dumbbell Pullover (Back Focus)
description: While this exercise can target the chest, a back-focused variation emphasizes stretching and contracting the lats.

name: Wide-Grip Pull-Up
description: A pull-up variation with a wide grip, focusing more on the outer lats and upper back muscles.

name: Pendlay Row
description: A strict row variation where the barbell rests on the ground between each rep, emphasizing the lats and lower back.

name: Rack Pull
description: A partial deadlift movement that focuses on the upper and middle back. The barbell is pulled from a raised position, such as on blocks or a rack.

name: Landmine Row
description: Using a landmine attachment, this row variation allows for a deep range of motion and targets the middle back and lats.

name: Overhead Barbell Press
description: A fundamental shoulder exercise that targets the deltoids and triceps. Performed by pressing a barbell overhead from shoulder level.

name: Arnold Press
description: A variation of the shoulder press that involves a rotational movement to target all three heads of the deltoid.

name: Lateral Raise
description: Targets the medial deltoid, performed by raising dumbbells out to the side to shoulder height.

name: Front Raise
description: Focuses on the anterior deltoid by raising dumbbells in front of you to shoulder level.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: A classic shoulder exercise where you press dumbbells overhead to target all heads of the deltoids.

name: Machine Shoulder Press
description: Performed on a machine for stability, it targets the deltoids and triceps while minimizing lower body engagement.

name: Reverse Pec Deck Fly
description: Targets the rear deltoids and upper back by pulling the handles of the pec deck machine backwards.

name: Face Pull
description: A cable exercise targeting the rear deltoids and upper back by pulling the cable towards your face with elbows flared.

name: Upright Row
description: Performed by pulling a barbell or dumbbells up towards your chin, this exercise targets the traps and shoulders.

name: Cable Lateral Raise
description: A variation of the lateral raise using a cable machine for constant tension on the medial deltoid.

name: Landmine Press
description: A unique pressing movement where a barbell is pressed at an angle, focusing on the anterior deltoids.

name: Bus Driver
description: A rotational shoulder exercise using a plate, designed to target the deltoids and improve shoulder stability.

name: Seated Dumbbell Press
description: Similar to the standing version, but seated for added stability, focusing on all heads of the deltoid.

name: Dumbbell Shrug
description: Primarily a trap exercise, shrugs target the upper shoulders and neck by lifting the shoulders while holding dumbbells.

name: Cable Front Raise
description: Using a cable machine, this exercise focuses on the anterior deltoid with constant tension throughout the movement.

name: Behind-the-Neck Press
description: A shoulder press variation performed by lowering the barbell behind the head. It targets the deltoids but requires good shoulder mobility.

name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Press
description: A unilateral version of the dumbbell press, focusing on one shoulder at a time for added core and shoulder stability.

name: Cable Reverse Fly
description: Using a cable machine, this exercise targets the rear delts and upper back by pulling the handles outward in a reverse fly motion.

name: Incline Dumbbell Raise
description: Performed on an incline bench, this movement targets the front deltoid by raising the dumbbells in front of you.

name: Overhead Kettlebell Press
description: A shoulder press variation using kettlebells, focusing on the deltoids and stabilizer muscles due to the unique grip.

name: Barbell Curl
description: The classic bicep-building exercise performed by curling a barbell up towards your chest, focusing on the biceps brachii.

name: Dumbbell Curl
description: A basic bicep exercise performed with dumbbells to focus on each arm independently.

name: Hammer Curl
description: A variation of the bicep curl where you hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip, targeting the brachialis and brachioradialis muscles.

name: Preacher Curl
description: Performed on a preacher bench, this exercise isolates the biceps by limiting the movement of your shoulders.

name: Concentration Curl
description: An isolation exercise that focuses on the peak of the bicep by curling a dumbbell with your elbow braced against your thigh.

name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
description: Performed on an incline bench, this exercise emphasizes the stretch at the bottom of the movement, targeting the long head of the biceps.

name: Cable Curl
description: Performed using a cable machine for constant tension throughout the range of motion, targeting the biceps.

name: EZ Bar Curl
description: A bicep curl performed with an EZ bar to reduce strain on the wrists, focusing on both heads of the biceps.

name: Spider Curl
description: Performed by curling a barbell or dumbbells while lying face down on an incline bench, this exercise isolates the biceps.

name: Zottman Curl
description: A combination curl that targets both the biceps and forearms by rotating from a standard curl to a reverse curl at the top of the movement.

name: Tricep Dips
description: A bodyweight exercise that targets the triceps by lowering and raising your body using parallel bars or a bench.

name: Skull Crushers
description: Performed by lowering a barbell or dumbbells towards your forehead while lying down, this exercise isolates the triceps.

name: Tricep Pushdown
description: Performed using a cable machine, this exercise focuses on the triceps by pushing the bar or rope attachment downwards.

name: Close-Grip Bench Press
description: A variation of the bench press that emphasizes the triceps by using a narrow grip.

name: Overhead Tricep Extension
description: Performed by extending a dumbbell or barbell overhead to target the long head of the triceps.

name: Cable Overhead Tricep Extension
description: A cable variation of the overhead tricep extension, providing constant tension throughout the movement.

name: Kickbacks
description: Performed by extending dumbbells behind you while bent over, focusing on the triceps.

name: Rope Tricep Extension
description: Using a rope attachment on a cable machine, this exercise targets the triceps by pulling the rope apart at the bottom of the movement.

name: Diamond Push-Ups
description: A push-up variation where your hands are placed close together to form a diamond shape, emphasizing the triceps.

name: Bench Dip
description: A bodyweight exercise where you dip between two benches to target the triceps, shoulders, and chest.

name: Barbell Back Squat
description: The classic squat that targets the quadriceps by lowering and raising a barbell placed on your upper back.

name: Front Squat
description: Performed by holding the barbell in front of your body on your shoulders, targeting the quads more than a back squat.

name: Leg Press
description: A machine exercise where you push a weighted platform away from you, focusing on the quadriceps.

name: Lunges
description: A dynamic leg exercise that targets the quads, performed by stepping forward and lowering your body with each leg.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
description: A unilateral leg exercise where one leg is elevated behind you on a bench, focusing on quad strength and balance.

name: Leg Extension
description: Performed on a leg extension machine, this isolation exercise focuses directly on the quadriceps by extending the knees.

name: Step-Ups
description: Performed by stepping onto a bench or platform with a dumbbell or barbell, this exercise targets the quads.

name: Goblet Squat
description: A squat variation performed by holding a dumbbell or kettlebell at chest level, targeting the quads.

name: Sissy Squat
description: An advanced bodyweight squat that isolates the quads by leaning back while keeping your hips extended.

name: Wall Sit
description: A static exercise where you sit against a wall in a squat position, holding the tension in the quads for as long as possible.

name: Romanian Deadlift
description: A deadlift variation that targets the hamstrings by keeping the legs slightly bent while lowering the barbell.

name: Leg Curl
description: An isolation machine exercise that targets the hamstrings by curling your legs towards your glutes.

name: Stiff-Leg Deadlift
description: A deadlift variation where the legs remain straight, targeting the hamstrings and lower back.

name: Glute-Ham Raise
description: An exercise performed on a glute-ham developer (GHD), focusing on the hamstrings as you lift your body.

name: Good Mornings
description: A hip-hinge movement that targets the hamstrings and lower back by bending forward with a barbell on your back.

name: Kettlebell Swing
description: A dynamic exercise that targets the hamstrings and glutes through explosive hip extensions with a kettlebell.

name: Single-Leg Romanian Deadlift
description: A unilateral exercise where one leg is raised behind you while the other supports your weight, targeting the hamstrings.

name: Cable Pull-Through
description: Performed by pulling a cable between your legs from behind, this exercise targets the hamstrings and glutes.

name: Nordic Hamstring Curl
description: An advanced bodyweight exercise where you control the lowering phase of the hamstring curl on the ground.

name: Reverse Hyperextension
description: Performed on a reverse hyper machine, this exercise targets the hamstrings and lower back by extending your legs behind you.

name: Hip Thrust
description: A glute-focused exercise performed by driving your hips upward with a barbell resting across your hips.

name: Glute Bridge
description: A bodyweight or weighted exercise where you raise your hips off the ground, focusing on the glutes.

name: Cable Kickbacks
description: A cable machine exercise where you extend your leg behind you, targeting the glutes.

name: Step-Ups
description: Performed by stepping onto a bench or platform, this exercise targets both the quads and glutes.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
description: A unilateral leg exercise where one leg is elevated behind you, targeting the quads and glutes.

name: Standing Calf Raise
description: Performed on a standing calf raise machine, this exercise targets the gastrocnemius muscle by raising onto your toes.

name: Seated Calf Raise
description: A calf isolation exercise performed while seated, targeting the soleus muscle of the calves.

name: Donkey Calf Raise
description: An advanced calf raise performed by leaning forward with your hips hinged and raising your heels.

name: Calf Press on Leg Press Machine
description: Performed on a leg press machine by pushing through your toes, this exercise targets the calves.

name: Single-Leg Calf Raise
description: A unilateral calf exercise where you raise your body onto the toes of one leg at a time.
